values:
when life catches up to you, what do you do? is there a safe haven to hide out in until the storm passes? are there teams to help me rebuild the ruins of my own life? what have i become? what does it mean when you are unrecognizable to even yourself? people change; it's a fact of life; but like this? this isn't a change...this is mid-life crisis twenty years premature. i have spent time with some people from my past, and it's made me realize how different i am now. the idea of matching up my present person with their prior person appeals to me. i feel like i've been basking in nostalgia only to realize that it's only that--nostalgia, instead of the present here and now. 
looking back at my live journal entry from two years ago (to the day) i discovered something ironic. i won't mention it, though. i feel like i'm living in a fictional world.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/134919.html
a lot to share, not enough time; nothing finalized. funny funny stuff, though.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/134548.html

Do I only post negative stuff now? I don't know...maybe that's all that seems interesting enough to post right now. Yesterday we had a guest in Ruby's that owns a bar in Atlanta. he offered for melissa (one of the other bartenders) and i to come up and work like a wed, thurs, fri every now and then--make like $800 a night. that would be crazy awesome. ironic part is that melissa and i had just been sitting down talking about how much we like bartending and how we wanted to work at just a bar; instead of a restaurant with a bar. ruby's bar doesn't make very much b/c it's not that cool. i feel kinda bad about serving drinks, but i love making them--it's fun--and the money's definitely better. we may go up to ATL and do that next month sometime--i can't right now b/c of class, but when school's out i may do that. i had a horrible night at work last night. it was to the point where i stormed out the backdoor fuming, and had to control myself so that i wouldn't full on bawl. i was tearing up a bit--the first time that's ever happened there. the cooks just pissed me off soooooooooo bad that i wanted to slug half of them until they couldn't cook ever again. i was ready to turn in my 2 weeks notice at the end of the night, but then i realized i don't have anywhere else to go. i may apply at longhorn to just work the bar. or i may see about transferring down to the valdosta ruby's for a little bit. i don't know, but i need to talk to my general manager and i couldn't get ahold of him last night. on a good note--i went out to steak and shake with ben last night. that was the first time we've hung out just the two of us. it was nice--not awkward at all. i don't know where this is all leading, and i don't want to say anything on here in case he, by some odd-odd chance, reads it. and finally--still haven't been getting the sleep i need. i work late tonight, but i'm not going to let myself do anything after work--straight to bed for me. and i get to sleep in a bit tomorrow before i have to finalize a paper and study for an exam in my Amer. Gov't class. eek!
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/134191.html

i am a mess! wednesday: bar shift till midnight--then melissa (one of the girls i work with) and our manager, chris decided to go have drinks at locos--one of only two "bars" open past 11pm on weeknights. i know, i know--i don't drink. but it was fun. i had one drink...count them--ONE. it was called a royal flush and had cranberry juice, orange juice, and crown royal. it was actually pretty good. my friend matt saw my car and came over too. it was just relaxing and good conversation. nothing out of control. then matt and i went to waffle house. i didn't go to bed till like 3:30am thursday: lost my voice to the point that every third word was either silent or 3 pitches higher than normal. went to my college group--couldn't sing along with worship very well. stopped by ruby's on my way to starbucks and met up with some of my friends/guests. we decided to meet up at locos after i went to starbucks for a bit. so me, ben, josh, chris, and matt met up there. more people that night--met sophie (works with the guys); some of their co-workers were there and were completely drunk (sohie wasn't drunk). they happen to work at Target where tim (my brother) works. anyway...i had two drinks that night--i didn't care for either. from there we went to City Limits (the other bar still open) and played pool--no drinkin' there. then off to waffle house. ben and i had really hit it off (i hadn't hung out with him before)--he paid for my waffle. lol. went home--ben and i texted till 4:45am, at which time he called me. talked till 6:30am--then i had to get ready to go to class. we talked for another 1 1/2 after i got ready and was driving down to valdosta--so i didn't sleep at all that night. friday: nap before work--only about 1 1/2 hours. still hardly any voice, and they were fully staffed at work, so i got off. ALMOST one $143 on "Beat the Buzzer" on the radio station, but the buzzer beat me! should have gone back to sleep, but went out to dinner with ben and chris--ben paid again. then we went to get his drums from a friend's house--a girl named ashley that just started at ruby's. hung out there for a while, set the drums up at chris's (he's going to try to learn to play). went to locos--waaaaaaaaaay too many people there. one drink--white russian. over to City limits--no drinking for me--just call me DD Traci :o/ then over to Daniel's. hung out by the pool--too cold to swim. went home at 5:30--in bed by 6:30am saturday: up at 9:30am--got ready--went to lunch with adrielle and the college leader from tim and stace's church. starbucks--gave a different Daniel Adrielle's number. work--shift lead till after midnight. ben, josh, and chris came in to eat--talked to them for a while. was the only "manager" on the floor on a saturday night--craziness. had a lot of awful tables to deal with. went over to josh's after work--ben, chris, josh, sophie, and a couple other people were there. ben played guitar for a while--pretty amazing on it, too. left around 7am. in bed by 7:15am sunday: 1 1/2 hours later i got up for church. good message, blah lunch, good nap (2 1/2 hours) and off to work. really good shift up until 9pm when the proverbial $**t hit the fan. let me summarize in semi-rhyming form--vomit on the bathroom door, bucket of cucumbers on the dining room floor; too many people in a sardine booth, the table next to them got cold soup. cooks don't know how to do their work, some servers being jerks. had to stay 2 hours more, and do someone else's cleanup chores. home at midnight--talked to ben for 10 mins, and went to bed by 12:30. today thus far: running on low sleep as a result of my "wild" weekend. still don't have my voice completely back. coulda won $100 from the same radio station if i stopped in at chik-fil-a, but i didn't have time...despite the fact that i was at starbucks and they are directly across the street from each other. and my first class stunk! that's my week/weekend.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/133968.html

in a moment of weakness when idiocracy got the better of my judgemetent i sent Chris the following:
"wow, looks like you bounce back quickly. hope you have better luck with ingrid."
man...i can be spiteful when i allow it. an hour or so later i wrote a brief e-mail of apology. crap! i always feel guilty, but Craig actually encouraged me to do it. he's the leader of the band chris is in, and basically said he can't keep taking my side if i stoop to chris's level. lol. ouch.
in other news, i have connor for the weekend, but since they didn't tell me till last minute that they needed someone, i set up other babysitters for when i'm at work. thanks, me! i feel like a little mommy with him sometimes, and i think i love him like that, too. my car is fixed (until the next problem it brings on).
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/133755.html

walking alone; don't feel like seeing people. nothing to say, so Dashboard speaks for me. ironic that the same name that is soothing me is the one that hurt me to begin with. so this is what it feels like? rejection, that is. i still don't understand. what changed? what a gammit of emotions. i even said a$$ at one point last night. i do believe that was the first time i've ever sworn intentionally and meant it. what brought me to feel like this in such a short time? from blissful, to frustrated, to mad, to irate, to confused, to depressed, and everything in between. things don't change that dramatically in 24 hours without something significant happening. i'm lost. i feel ripped in two. i feel neglected, robbed, used and discarded, crushed. there are too many negatives to describe how i feel, but that's a start. i haven't cried yet. i don't know if it's because i'm being stubborn, or if crying is admitting failure...or that i've given up--i haven't. class calls...i must answer.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/133560.html

wow, life is fascinating. i leave in a day and a half for Tennessee to see a boy. I am so excited! Chris and i have been talking for just over a month now, but because we've only been able to talk, we've gotten to know each other fairly well. it has just been a really interesting 4 weeks. and then this past week i put my car in the ditch next to my driveway. i was backing out and didn't realize how close i was to it. tim had to pull me out with his truck. it was pretty funny--no damage to the car. this was right after we had finished putting the doughnut on so that i could get the new tire installed. and then i did this--you can't quite tell, but the back right tire was about 3 feet off the ground. those where taken with my phone--i'm impressed, myself.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/133358.html

gaaaaaaaaa! i got completely ready to leave for class, and at 7:40am i go out to my car and my front driver's side tire is flat. by the time i would put the doughnut on (assuming i could do it) it would be missing my first class, and i am not driving a hour (one way) just for my second class--american government. CRAP!!! that means i only have one other day i can miss these class before points start getting counted of. poop! i'm aggitated right now. at least i get to go back to sleep, and i will have plenty of time to get ready for work. this stinks, though. now i have to put out the money to get a new tire, and i can't even find a retailer in the area that has these tires. ok...i'm just going to go back to sleep and worry about it when tim gets up.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/132983.html

*Sigh* Sometimes boys can actually be worth the stress! Chris, the guy from the worship team, and I have been talking every day since he sent me flowers. It's been really nice. Just friends, and none of the physical stuff that tends to blind true feelings and replaces them with lust. I am planning a trip to go see him (and the band) over my spring break--the 13th-17th. I hope that goes well. We'll see what comes of that.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/132661.html

Please go here and do this for me. It will only take 2 minutes of your time.
http://kevan.org/johari?name=aplentpak
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/132474.html
don't fall too fast, traci...don't do it!
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/132194.html

Friday night: horrible night! cramps to the max! drunken ex-boyfriend at my work. boss had to help him out. and dropped my phone in the toilet, bringing it to it's death. Saturday: $200 later--new mobile. bar-tended in the morning; made pretty much nothing. waited tables at night; host had no idea what he was doing. however...had an awesome party of 6 guys; 1 girl--Craig, Brittany, Jeff, Brent, Chris, Ben, and Travis. traveling worship team (The Jonathan Project) from nashville. cute guys. highly friendly and outgoing. invited me to their "revival" at a local church on monday. big tip. Sunday: barely maintained consciousness at my brother's church. wore a scarf adam gave me. ruby tuesday for lunch. didn't wear the scarf in. had a good lunch with tim, stace, and connor. saw adam on my way out (really glad i wasn't wearing the scarf); didn't acknowledge each other. nap. studying. staff meeting. retarded movie with jose--Devon's Ghost...don't watch it. Monday: test--bombed it. class. nap. revival at 7; took Adrielle with me. supposed to go see a movie with blake at 9:40. canceled to go to dinner with the band. sat in between Chris and Adrielle. awesome conversation. oh how i hate goodbyes. in the car, Adrielle and i acted all girly about the guys and their good looks. haha. Tuesday: single again on valentines day. took all of 2 To Go orders in the morning--no money. restocked, organized, and cleaned the bar b/c i was bored. lunch. TV. back to work. saw a bum near ruby's. told him to ride his bike to ruby's and i'd pay for his dinner. hamburger, sweet tea, and ice-cream. andy was his name. time to work. Expo. received flowers...from Chris (from the band)! absolutely the most flattering thing ever! too busy to call and thank him. work. stress. thinking about calling chris. still working. stress. 11:00--freedom. called Chris. their in Mississippi. talked for around an hour. i'm smiling; he's smiling. arranged my flowers in a vase at home. still smiling. parker's spending the night b/c he's on Connor duty while tim and stace are gone. talked. shower. talked. TV. bed.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/131918.html

Guys, I dropped my cell phone in the toilet--don't ask--so I had to get a new phone. Therefore, I lost all of my numbers. If you feel like I should have your number, please e-mail or call me with it, and clarify whether it's a cell phone, home phone, etc. Thanks!
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/131738.html

hispanics have some strange attraction to me:
case 1.) last week i had a mexican sit at the bar and tell me i was "beaufidul" hmmm..i've never been told that before
2.)also last week, one of my venizualian friends was trying to ask me when we could hang out "just you and me"--no thanks, bud
3.)wednesday one of our cooks--Jose (actually rather attractive)--asked me when i was going to let him take me out on a date. i don't date work associates.
4.)last night some slight aquaintances--Vicash and Omar--called me over to there table b/c a different Jose was "admiring me from a distance" and wanted to ask for my number. he was lame, and not really an agressive, so i told them i'd give them my number and put $5 down that he wouldn't call. haha. lamo..no thanks.

at any rate...i don't know what they see...why hispanics? why not sexy europeans? lol.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/131528.html

it feels good to be single again--hung out with some of "the boys" last night--no strings attatched. waffle house all the way.
i feel sick--too much caramel macciatto.
i'm obsessed with Lost--I've been renting the season 1 disks to catch back up--can't wait till the year ends and season 2 is release on DVD. i've hooked tim (my brother) too.
at least 8 cooks at my school cafeteria (friday was the first time i went) are thai nationals. i got in line and asked for the fried fish in thai--took her a second to realize that i hadn't said it in english. i got to talk with them for a while, and will go again today after my next class. PRAISE the LORD b/c i've missed that like crazy. a few have already invited me over to dinner. hahah...i'm excited. wish there was a way i could go back to thailand....hmmmm....
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/131320.html

I stopped by my user info, and noticed this:
"To whom this may concern. . .
I'm sorry in advance 
truth may hurt, but it's worth it!"
It's been there forever, but it really hits home right now. I broke up with Adam 6 days ago, and I still feel like crap. Pretty much the worst case scenario--when I did it, that is. Just pray for me--we're trying to be friends, but it's hard. He's all depressed, and seems like he's hoping I'll change my mind. He's not the one for me, and I think I knew it from the start. It still sucks, though.

On another note--started class today--American Government and Intro to Social Problems is all I have. I wish I could take more, but funds will not allow. Really not excited about A.G., but I had to take it sooner or later. Better now while I only have one other class to worry about.

had the most amazing talk with Adam last night. i love being with him...and he says the cutest things to me. *dramatic sigh* i have to work tonight, but he's coming in to visit. ahhhh...i'm not getting all girly, i promise. this is specifically for heather. this is adam--my little redneck.

how about--i bought an ipod off of one of my co-workers for $100 last night. not the wisest choice for my funds right now, but an offer i couldn't pass up. she had it for a while and didn't use it much, and then she won another one. now i need to figure out how to use it.

I decided to post some lovely photos. most of them are of me and Adrielle--seeing as we are basically attached at the hip; but some of the others were fun, too. Ben and me--the green tongue was the result of an ice pop. Brittany and me Andy and me Adrielle and me Matt wearing my jacket--the one i bought off of lo's little sister matt and me at Zaxby's matt and his dad--Pastor Mike Ben wearing my pants (matt and ben are brothers) Me pretending to sleep on Samantha's foot adrielle and sam in the sunset

last night was a lot of fun--Hay Day at New Covenant church. Adrielle and i were in charge of supervising the inflatable jumping room. that was lame-o, but watching the guys do the sumo wrestling was amazing, being with **** was wonderful, dressing up in luau clothes was fun, and hanging out at starbucks afterward was great (as usual). i'll have to get some photos up here soon. Things are developing...i can't say much yet. being gone for 4 1/2 days will take it's toll, i'm sure. but....oh, i can't say anything else for now. maybe in a few weeks--we'll see. 
P.S. everyone needs to go listen to the above song! It will change your life!

that was by far my worst night yet--here in tifton, that is. from crappy tips, to babysitting inebriated friends, to panicking b/c tim, stacey and connor weren't at home at 4am when i got home and i couldn't get a hold of them--i went as far as to call the police and the hospital. it was just a rough night, let me tell you! this morning at work wasn't so much better, either. pray for me--quick nap and then back to work.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/128934.html

up and down; up and down--life is crazy. boys are just as confusing as girls, jon. i'm impatient with the latter--boys, i mean, not jon. i'm feeling emo today--major sleep issues last night may be to blame. i don't know what else to say for now.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/128720.html

any of my friends gonna be in the NYC area nov 6th-9th? i'm flying home for a surprise baby shower for my sister. i love surprises!!! especially ones on this scale. she has no idea i'm-a coming. *cue triumphant music* DUN DUN DUHNUN!!!
little Ethan Jared Burgos is like an alien in my sister's body. muuuuuuuuuahaha

I got off of work friday night and was checking my voicemails--unknown number, josh, and adrielle. so i listen to the voicemails--the unknown number was from cody and kevin of The Wedding--awesome band! A couple of my friends had gone to see them, and one of the girls went to high school with the guys back in arkansas. she found out i really like them (the band) and had them leave me a voice mail since i couldn't come to the show. i 'bout jumped out of my skin! Go check them out at http://www.theweddingrock.com

I have found some major joys in some minor things lately. For example...
Tuesday at work, they quit playing the same station that's been on for weeks--some 80s stuff; not the good 80s, but the stuff that didn't make the cut. Anyway, in place of it, they were playing stuff like Jimmy Eat World, FallOutBoy, Jack Johnson, OK Go, Keane, Snow Patrol, All American Rejects, etc. I 'bout fell over when JEW came on. I couldn't believe it. Then it just got better from there. when they played OK Go, i cracked up--i love "Get Over It," but they swear in it. instead of just bleeping out the word, they just copied the line that follows it, and dubbed it over it. i was giggling up at the hostess stand.
Other things that amuse me:
^adrielle and i pranked josh to the max this weekend. we "redecorated his room"--frozen boxers, porcelin figurines to replace the shrine of "orange crush" bottles, a new [severely yucky, tacky, and old] bedspread, flipped furniture, tiger-stripped curtains, faux-flowers to greet him at his door, etc.
^Connor--always a riot; even when he's bad
^phone calls from "long lost friends"--i.e. josh steinmetz
^the cooks at work
^unexpected visits from "lovers" j/k
^thai food--twice in one week--i'm a master chef now
^people that don't remember things that happened b/c they were intoxicated during the fact (i just laugh at them because they're stupid for doing that) i'm mean, i know
^wearing cut up shirts that look like they're from the 80s
^realizing that the awful test you have is not in fact the next day, but a week away
^12:15--the time that my art history class ends
and i'm sure there are other things that i can't think of right now. i'm in between classes, and i need to read before my composition class.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/127502.html

There are a million ants on one pair of my shorts right now. They bit me earlier, and it itches, and hurts, and burns: Connor got a spider bite on his eyebrow last week--Tim and I called him Mike Tyson: This is why I love Josh:

connor did the funniest thing today. tim, connor, and i went out to waffle house for breakfast...connor grabbed a creamer container (a full one), put it butt-end in his mouth, and just bit down. the whole thing popped, sending a shower of half and half everywhere. the glass window was speckled with it--about a 4ft diameter, and i had it allllllll over. tim's initial reaction was to get on connor, but he took one look at me and we both just cracked up. it was soooooo funny, and we couldn't possibly get serious to reprimand connor at that point. so i spent the rest of our time wiping creamer off of me, but it was well worth it for the laugh. connor didn't seem to like the taste of it, either, so he had a funny face.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/126570.html

What a week of trials it has been! I can't say much on here, but I know some of you have been praying for me, and I severely appreciate that!!! Things have started to look up, but I still need prayer.

Gas prices bite! I have to drive 4 hours a week to get to school and back, and at $3 a gallon, I'll be spending like $40 a week in gas. I do not make enough money to afford that, but I obviously have to get to school. I'm going to try to find someone that commutes like me, and maybe get a carpool going on.

Tonight is our college group--The Outlet. I really, really need it tonight. I have been falling away from God in the past 2 weeks; I feel it. I have gotten caught up in work, school, and friends, and have neglected time with Him. I am feeling the depression of it all, and it bothers me--hopefully enough that I will spend more and more time with Him. You can be praying for that, too, please.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/126343.html

When reality sets in, it is often this eye-opening experience. It doesn't have to be fun, or exciting, or even invigorating--in fact--for me, it was much the opposite. It wasn't so long ago, and I can still picture us laying there. My eyes were open--literally--and a dawning came across my face. It was too dark in the room, though, so he couldn't see. It was probably a sort of pained expression, a realization of inadequacy. However, I don't feel inadequate--not like I thought I would. I continued to ask questions, and he even encouraged them--"we are on the pursuit of best friendom...best friends are open with each other." But I still could not believe the ease with which he answer--as if it was common. As if this sort of thing went on all across town. Maybe it does and I'm just unaware, but it seems rather odd that this time of thing would be occuring all around me while I remain clueless. Regardless, I still questioned my motives. Why was I laying there to begin with? What was the purpose of me being there? I knew exactly why, and I knew it wasn't necessary. His eyes where closed; I could feel his heart beating; his breath was coming in slow rhythmic patterns now, that lulled me into a near dreamlike state. I pictured myself as a chess pawn--as if he was moving both sides, yet keeping them always against each other. In that same moment, though, I saw myself as the chess player--I'd move one of my pawns to a defenseless position--awaiting the inevitable attack--almost yearning for it; then I would wait to see how he would react. Would he allow me to advance a step, would he block me, or would he take one of my pieces from the board? Despite...looking back, I can remember a sort of calm--as if I had less to concern myself with now. I could let him "win," yet still survive with a few pawns intact. In retrospect i feel so foolish--and I told him this. How could I have let things get this far? Sure, I kept my "key" discretions intact--but I faltered elsewhere. I let my guard down, and now I will have this with me for years to come--possibly forever. Nothing really changed that night; no miracle happened; no great revelation; but I realized something...I realized I had set up the game myself. I had put the pieces on the board and asked him to play. Sure, he was a willing participant; in fact, I knew he wanted to play even before I had asked. But I was the one that took the initiative. I had begun laying out the pieces that very first night--the night we met. It seems so long ago now. I remember it very clearly, though--the awkward glances, the desire to talk to him but no knowledge of how to approach, the eventual conversation, the comfort of his presence, then her calls. What happened after that? Why are things so far from that now? Why do I feel like I have become a different person through it all? Have I really digressed to what I once was; to what I said I would never be again? Time flew by at increased speeds; what wasn't really there seemed so obvious to others--and it disgusts me now. I am not bitter; I am not angry; I am not even melancholy--I am, however, reflective. I am learned--far greater than any book could ever teach me. I am stronger through the humility of it all. I am wiser than before, but I am also more skeptical, more fearful, and just as susceptible to the very same thing. I am prone to blunder, but I am the better for it now. I am more prepared.
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/125498.html

what do two college students (1 male; 1 female) do when left alone in an apartment? well, for these two--probably not what you'd expect. It was all his idea! He made me put the jumpsuit on--and then i said that since i had my camera, he should get something on, too. oh, the lives of "good little Christians." forget the booze; who needs pot; "let's just be friends"! the end
http://aplentpak.livejournal.com/125250.html

sometimes i wonder if i'm in serious need of therapy. it's been a good, yet frustrating week. more friends--less money. i start working tues, but that's not fast enough b/c i don't know when i'll actually start reaping the benefits of that. probably later than what i need. anyway, i can't get homework done here b/c there are too many distractions--the computer being one of them. and my school's too far to just "pop" over to the library. i'm going to see about using ABAC's (the local agricultural college) library. i don't think i need an ID to just get in there. that place is less than 10 mins from me, so it would be a lot easier. i want to take a nap, but i only woke up at 10:30am...and it's only 12:45pm now. i'm just being lazy--i need to do homework---ahhhh!

I made thai food again today--this time i made enough for an army, versus just myself. however, mid-squash-cutting, i sliced my thumb. i still don't know how it happened, but all of a sudden i felt the pressure, and saw the blood immediately. i was like "CUT MYSELF; BLEEDING!" and turned on the faucet. tim and stace came over to see what happened, and i started to panic b/c of all the blood. it was making the water red, all over my hand, on the stove, on the floor. i started getting light-headed, started seeing spots, and i got really hot. it took like 10 mins just to stop bleeding, and i still hadn't seen the actual cut. i had to sit down; right on the ground at one point b/c i thought i was just going to pass out. definitely not good with blood. they babied me through it all, though. I tried to take the bandaids off tonight--i wanted to see the damage--but it started to bleed through the first two bandaids before i even got the first one off, so i decided to wait on that. maybe tomorrow it will be done bleeding. Stacey thought i may need stitches, and tim said i nearly cut the tip of my thumb off. yuck! i finished making dinner, though. tim cut the rest of the squash for me. then after dinner, we went Geocaching. Definition: a type of scavenger hunt for waterproof containers bearing treasure using the containers' exact geographic coordinates and Global Positioning System devices. Basically...people hide stuff, put the coordinates (using GPS) on the Geocaching website, and then other people use the coordinates w/ GPS to go find it. Most of them are just little containers with a list to sign that you've found it. Thus the photo. Tim's holding the film container that it was in, stacey's holding the GPS, and the tree it was hidden in is right behind me in the photo. It was a good time.

It was a really good night tonight. I went to bible study, then out to Applebees with the gang, then to Starbucks, and then back to Ben's. We lounged at Ben's for a while--me, michael, matt, ben, erin, brittany, and jeremy. then we decided to go star-gazing. matt went to bed, while erin, brit, and ben got in the golf cart; spencer, me and jeremy took the go-cart; and michael road a bike. we tore it up in the go-cart. i definitely thought we were going to flip over at least 3 times. besides, that go-cart was only meant for 2 people, and i was shoved in the middle, sitting on a cushion on top of the bars--very interesting. anyway, we went out to this field, all laid down on the dirt, and looked up. the stars weren't that bright, though, so we really couldn't make out any constellations. so we drove around a bit more. after that, we slowly dwindled; one or two of us leaving at a time. i, myself, dropped erin off and got home around 3am. i really had a lot of fun, though. too bad that half of that group is leaving for school saturday.
